definition: Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
to return in low spirits following a defeat or failure to achieve one's ambitions (idiom)
levitation (of Daoist immortal)/to become as light as a feather and ascend to heaven/(in Daoism) to become immortal/to die/of winged insects, to emerge from the cocoon in adult form/eclosion
Lu Yu (733-804), Chinese writer from Tang dynasty, known for his obsession with tea

sentences.english: With 11)rustling feathers, they swam lightly over the water.
sentences.chinese: 他們輕飄飄地浮在水上，羽毛髮出颼颼的響聲。

sentences.english: Kasatochi, Okmok and Cleveland all spewed giant ash plumes into the air.
sentences.chinese: 奧克莫克和騎士都噴出火山灰在空中巨人羽。

sentences.english: The fossils all have feathers or feather-like structures.
sentences.chinese: 這些化石都顯現出附有羽毛或或羽毛類結構。

sentences.english: Murong Yujun was born in Guangzhou in 1927 with the original name of Li Weike.
sentences.chinese: 慕容羽軍，本名李維克，一九二七年出生於廣州。

sentences.english: It also blew a gaping hole in one wall of the badminton court nearby.
sentences.chinese: 羽球場附近的法院圍牆也被炸開一個裂口。

sentences.english: In stage 4 the capacity to grow differentiated barbules evolved.
sentences.chinese: 階段4演化出羽小枝的分化能力。

sentences.english: Beak and Feather Disease can affect all Old World and New World Parrots.
sentences.chinese: 鸚鵡喙羽病會影響成年鳥和幼鳥。

sentences.english: It had four long tail feathers but there is little evidence that it could fly.
sentences.chinese: 它有4條長尾羽但仍然幾乎沒有證據證明它會飛。

sentences.english: This program needs a Cembalo and a Piano.
sentences.chinese: 此曲目需要一部羽管鍵琴和一架鋼琴。

definition: Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
courtesy name of Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
Pang De (-219), general of Cao Wei at the start of the Three Kingdoms period, victor over Guan Yu 關羽|关羽/Pound (name)/Ezra Pound (1885-1972), American poet and translator
Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor
Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
